column1: I. HIGH-LEVEL REPORTS (For CHED Buy-In & Policy Support)
These are decision-level reports that CHED will usually look for.
1. National Demand Report for ETEEAP–BS Social Work
○       Central Office, Field Offices, Attached Agencies
●       Overall level of interest in ETEEAP–BSSW
👉 Is there sufficient nationwide demand to justify offering the program?
(This directly answers your “How many are potential to apply?” question)
●       “If offered, will you apply for ETEEAP–BSSW?”
●       Conservative, moderate, and optimistic applicant projections
👉 How many enrollees can realistically be expected per batch?
●       % of respondents who meet typical ETEEAP minimum requirements
👉 Are the prospective learners academically and experientially qualified for ETEEAP?
II. WORKFORCE PROFILE REPORTS (Very Important for Buy-In)
4. DSWD Social Welfare Workforce Profile Report
(This supports your point on numbers of SWA, PDO I–IV, etc.)
●       By Field Office and nationwide totals
👉 Clear picture of the target learner population.
5. Regional Distribution of Potential ETEEAP Learners
●       Number of interested applicants per FO
●       Heat map of demand by region
👉 Where should pilot batches be launched first?
6. Social Work Functions & Competency Alignment Report
👉 Does the actual work of DSWD personnel align with the BSSW curriculum?
7. Years of Experience vs Interest Level Analysis
●       Years of SW-related experience × Interest in ETEEAP
○       Younger workforce with long-term pipeline potential
👉 Is ETEEAP addressing mid-career and senior practitioners?
●       Non-BSSW degree holders currently performing SW functions
👉 Shows the need for equivalency and accreditation pathways.
●       % who have taken DSWD Academy courses
👉 Demonstrates structured prior learning eligible for accreditation.
V. INTEREST, MOTIVATION & BARRIERS (Program Design Evidence)
10. Motivation for Enrolling in ETEEAP–BSSW Report
11. Barriers to Participation & Risk Assessment Report
👉 What policy or institutional support is needed?
👉 Formal justification for CHED approval and partnership.
